byline.contributor: Reporting on the aftermath of the explosion and fire in the East Village was contributed by Matt A.V. Chaban, Annie Correal, Matt Flegenheimer, Jiha Ham, Benjamin Mueller, Tatiana Schlossberg, Nate Schweber, Liam Stack, Nikita Stewart, John Surico and Alex Vadukul. Susan Beachy contributed research.
byline.original: By KIRK SEMPLE and ANNIE CORREAL

abstract: Occupants of three East Village buildings destroyed by explosion and fire are grappling with painful reality of their upended lives, while friends and family of Moises Ismael Locon Yac and Nicholas Figueroa, two young men who remain unaccounted for, have begun to fear the worst.
lead_paragraph: One young man presumed missing was on a date at a sushi restaurant on Second Avenue. The second missing person is a busboy at the restaurant.

headline.main: Extent of Losses Begins to Come Into Focus a Day After an East Village Explosion
headline.print_headline: The Extent of Losses Begins to Come Into Focus for Families, Friends and Residents

snippet: One young man presumed missing was on a date at a sushi restaurant on Second Avenue. The second missing person is a busboy at the restaurant.
